notes: Classified as hazardous material - risk of fire or overheating if mishandled
Contains high alcohol content - treated as Class 3 flammable liquid
Cannot be shipped by standard carriers (explosive hazard)
Illegal to ship marijuana or CBD products (banned substance)
Trade in ivory is banned (CITES restrictions)
Requires special contract and documentation (weapon regulations)
Special live animal shipping service required (not in regular parcel)
Food/perishable items require temperature control and fast delivery
Pressurized spray cans may be flammable or explosive; usually ground-only
Releases CO2 gas; needs vented packaging and special air labeling
Explosives are banned by UPS, FedEx, DHL, and Canada Post
Human or animal remains and ashes are not accepted by major couriers
Plants and seeds require phytosanitary permits; many destinations restricted
Cash and bearer instruments cannot be shipped by most carriers
Loose gems or unset stones are banned due to high theft risk
Infectious substances and medical waste not accepted outside special services
Hazardous chemical or medical waste cannot travel in parcel networks
Requires age verification; many carriers ban international tobacco shipments
Vape devices contain lithium batteries; often ground-only and age-restricted
Alcohol requires permits and is restricted or banned to many destinations
Hemp-derived CBD allowed with documentation; marijuana products banned
Firearms and replicas banned internationally; highly regulated domestically
Strong magnets can affect aircraft instruments; require special packaging
Heavy or oversize items require special handling and may be refused
